nodes.text: Today, we will review the exam you took in our previous class. Most of you did very well on the test. I am gratified to know that I am not totally wasting my time when lecturing to this class.

The first question on the quiz was about the 'Way of the Küchenschabe.' Tell me, which statement was incorrect... that the Küchenschabe Way is about: assessing danger, avoiding all danger, looking for hiding places, listening, or all of the above?
Herr O'Conner, which statement do you believe to be incorrect?
According to your teachings, sir, the wrong answer is the one about avoiding all danger. The Way of the Cockroach is all about what to do when there is danger.

Correct. I am not here to coddle you. I expect you will all find yourselves in dangerous situations at one time or another. The 'Way of the Küchenschabe' is a method that enhances your chance of survival.
The answer that is most incorrect is the "All of the Above" one, since clearly they aren't all correct.
An interesting assessment, Herr O'Conner. However, what was the answer that invalidated this statement?
It was... um... the one about avoiding all danger.
Indeed. The Way of the Küchenschabe teaches you to be cautious in the presence of danger rather than to avoid it all together.
Er... the one about 'avoiding all danger'?
Yes. Pity you didn't realize that was the correct answer when you were taking the exam.
Herr Sosi?
Sir, the 'Way of the Küchenschabe' is a method of how to handle oneself in a dangerous situation rather than to avoid all dangers. Clearly answer number two is incorrect.

Yes. Rogues are not cowards. They do not cower from dangerous situations. Neither do they walk blissfully through the world heedless of danger. Instead, they look out for trouble and avoid it when possible.
Question number two was about avoiding danger. Question number three was about possible Rogue tools. Anything can be a tool in the hand of a Rogue.
Question number four was about the proper way to throw a dagger...
I thought the right answer was 'by the blade' like you demonstrated in class!
I did mention that the throwing knife I use is weighted so that the blade is the heaviest part. Not all knives are designed that way.
How are we supposed to remember that from one demonstration?
Fräulein, not all learning takes place in the classroom. There are instructions on throwing weapons posted in the Practice room.
I suggest you make use of all information around you if you want to be a successful Rogue.
Question number five involved avoiding the danger in the first place. Question number six was around the most important of all Rogue tools. Tell me, who knows what that tool might be?
Herr O'Conner?
The most important thing a Rogue can use is his brains.
Indeed. It's a pity that some of you don't put your brains to work more often.
His diploma from Hero-U.
And why do you say that?
Because any old thief can use his brains or his lockpicks or whatever, but only a Rogue from this school can use his diploma. It makes the Rogue appear to be a professional.
That is an interesting interpretation of the question.
After all the effort someone has to go through into get that diploma, it bloody well better be the most important tool he has.
The correct answer is, of course, 'brains.' if you show enough intelligence, you don't need to have a diploma to prove it.
Herr Sosi?
The most important tool a Rogue can use is his intelligence, Master von Urwald.
Indeed. If you use your intelligence and creativity, anything else can become a weapon or a tool.

The next question concerned why we do not speak of the Rogue School. The correct answer was all of the reasons given and more. You should no more admit to being a Rogue than you would admit to being a thief.
The following question concerned why you should show proper respect towards me. The only acceptable answer was "One does not go out of his or her way to provoke a wolf."
I thought it was because the Rogue rules say that we are always supposed to show proper respect towards authority.

You misinterpret the rules, Fräulein MacMichael. The rule states, "You will demonstrate proper respect for authority in the authority's presence." Once you are no longer in my presence, you are welcome to state your own opinions concerning me, flattering or not.

On the following question concerning the 'Way of the Fledermaus,' some of you guessed that it was the bat's agility rather than his keen hearing that you are supposed to mimic. If you but recall, the lesson was upon listening skills.
The last question concerned the 'Rogue of the Year.' if you did not discern that the correct answer was 'all of the above,' you are unlikely to earn that title.
Excellent marks on the test, Herr Sosi, Herr Kent, and Herr Kyro. I shall be watching you all closely in the next exam to prevent you from sharing answers.
Fräulein MacMichael, you did very well despite the quibbles you had with the phrasing of the questions.

nodes.message: Shawn's test score is ${ego.test1score} out of a possible 100.

nodes.text: I shall be keeping a very close eye upon you, Herr O'Conner. Your answers were far better than I expected from you.
You achieved a perfect score. Well done.
Herr O'Conner, you demonstrate that you are indeed capable of learning. Mr. Terk will be most disappointed to learn that you passed this test.
Out of a possible 100 points you scored a respectable ${ego.test1score}.
Herr O'Conner, your test score was most disappointing. Consider yourself on probation.
Out of a possible 100 points, I only managed to score ${ego.test1score}. I'd better get my act together or I'll be out on the streets.
You will not be eligible for elective classes until you improve your performance in this class.
Unfortunately, Fräulein Esme, your score was extremely disappointing. Unless you do something dramatic to improve your grade in the next test, I will have no option but to give you a failing grade.
I'll try, sir.
See that you do, Fräulein.
For the rest of you who did well on the exam, you now have the opportunity to sign up for elective classes. The university offers the following classes - First Aid and Science.
For those of you who show some talent for the mystical arts, like Herr O'Conner, you may also elect to take a basic Magic course.
These elective classes are held in the afternoon and last until the Midterm break. Please inform me which elective you choose to take.

nodes.name: First Aid Elective
nodes.description: I signed up for First Aid Class elective. Maybe it can keep me alive. It starts tomorrow at 3 in the infirmary.

nodes.text: Very well, the First Aid Class starts tomorrow afternoon at 3pm in the Infirmary.

nodes.name: Science Class
nodes.description:
Mad Scientist 101, here I come. Maybe I'll learn how to blow up the school.
It's at 3 tomorrow somewhere around the Nido King wing.

nodes.text: The Science Class will take place tomorrow afternoon at 3pm in the Science Laboratory tower off the Nido Wing.

nodes.name: Magic Class
nodes.description: I signed up for a magic class. Maybe I'll learn how to turn Sosi into a toad so that he looks more like what he is. It's tomorrow at 3 in the magic classroom. It's supposed to be near Nido wing... Funny, I've never noticed it before.

nodes.text: The Magic Class will take place tomorrow afternoon at 3pm in the Magic Classroom off the Nido King Wing.
Since you do not wish to expand your knowledge, Herr O'Conner, I trust that you will spend your afternoons with improving your Rogue skills.

nodes.name: Test Results
nodes.description: Guess I did better on the Rogue Test than Gerhard expected.

nodes.name: Stupid Test Results
nodes.description: I'm officially on Probation because of the dumb test.

nodes.text: I will see all of you tomorrow.
